squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx

Class AbstractTextScreen<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
      • squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx.AbstractSquidScreen<T>
        • squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx.AbstractTextScreen<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public abstract class AbstractTextScreen<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color>
extends AbstractSquidScreen<T>
    A screen designed to write some text in full screen. This class supports text alignment (left, center, right) and text wrapping (see wrap(int)).

    You may prefer using TextPanel or sometimes LinesPanel where you want to display more than a few words of legible wrapped text.

    Author:
    smelC

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractTextScreen

        public AbstractTextScreen(AbstractSquidScreen.SquidScreenInput<T> ssi,
                          List<IColoredString<T>> text,
                          int[] alignment)
        Parameters:
        ssi - See super class
        text - The text to display. From top to bottom. Use null members to jump lines.

        Give null if you want to set it later (using init(List, int[])).

        alignment - How to alignment members of text. -1 for left, 0 for center, 1 for right. The default is to align left

        Give null if you want to set it later (using init(List, int[])).

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(List<IColoredString<T>> text,
                 int[] alignment)
        You should call this method at most once. You should call this method only before rendering this screen.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to display. From top to bottom. Use null members to jump lines.
        alignment - How to alignment members of text. -1 for left, 0 for center, 1 for right. The default is to align left

      • wrap

        public void wrap(int width)
        Wraps the text inside this according to width. This screen's text must have been set already. This, of course, preserves the text alignment (if any).
        Parameters:
        width -
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this's text hasn't been initialized yet.

      • toIntArray

        @Deprecated
protected int[] toIntArray(Collection<Integer> l)
        Deprecated. Prefer using primitive-specific classes as mentioned in the full JavaDocs for this method
        Not usually needed; may be deleted in a future version. You can usually avoid boxed Integers with either IntVLA in squidlib-util or the variety of classes in libGDX that specialize in ints and can convert to primitive int arrays. IntArray, IntSet, IntMap, IntIntMap, ObjectIntMap, and so on.
        Parameters:
        l - a Collection of boxed Integers
        Returns:
        an int array
